page.title: 01Mauchline
page.content: Rolling farmland set amidst shelter belts of trees. While there are trees surviving from the 18thC 'improvements' many of the conifer replacements have been made since World War II. Farm mechanisation has considerably depleted the area's population. Farm cottages are quickly bought by commuters when they become vacant and few of the inhabitants live off the land. Most of the farms carry a dairy herd and Friesians now predominate largely replacing the once popular Ayrshire. The milk is produced either in the traditional byre or the more modern milking parlour. Every dairy farm has a bulk tank to hold the milk until collection by a road tanker with conveys milk to retail dairies or the SMMB Creamery at Bent on the outskirts of Mauchline. The land is used mainly for grazing with hay
